definition:
See Coke, n.

1. (Carp.)  A kind of tenon connecting the face of a scarfed timber with the face of another timber, or a dowel or pin of hard wood or iron uniting timbers. [Also spelt coag.] 2. A metallic bushing or strengthening piece in the center of a wooden block sheve.

To unite, as timbers, by means of tenons or dowels in the edges or face. Totten.
